definitions.definition: a man in relation to his natural child or children.
examples: dad; Moredaddy, pop, pa, dada, papa; old man, patriarch, paterfamilias "his mother and father"Moredaddy, pop, pa, dada, papa; old man, patriarch, paterfamilias his mother and father

definitions.definition: a male animal in relation to its offspring.

examples: ancestor, forefather, forebear, predecessor, antecedent, progenitor, primogenitor the religion of my fathers

definitions.definition: an important figure in the origin and early history of something.
examples: noun: founding father; plural noun: founding fathers

definitions.definition: a man who gives care and protection to someone or something.
examples: the prince is widely regarded as the father of the nation

definitions.definition: the oldest or most respected member of a society or other body.
examples: leader, elder, patriarch, official the city fathers

definitions.definition: (in Christian belief) the first person of the Trinity; God.
used in proper names, especially when personifying time or a river, to suggest an old and venerable character.
(often as a title or form of address) a priest.
synonyms: padre "ask the father to pray for you"

definitions.definition: early Christian theologians (in particular of the first five centuries) whose writings are regarded as especially authoritative.
treat with the protective care usually associated with a father.
be the source or originator of.
examples: a culture which has fathered half the popular music in the world
he fathered a child on a one-night stand

definitions.definition: assign the paternity of a child or responsibility for a book, idea, or action to.
examples: a collection of Irish stories was fathered on him

definitions.definition: appear as or admit that one is the father or originator of.
examples: a singular letter from a lady, requesting I would father a novel of hers
